trans-unit.source: Represents a control that displays hierarchical data in a tree structure that has items that can expand and collapse.
TreeView is an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl>, which means it can contain a collection of objects of any type (such as string, image, or panel).
For more information, see the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> class.
The following illustration shows a simple TreeView.

![TreeView illustration](~/add/media/treeviewillustration.JPG "TreeView illustration") The contents of a TreeView are <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> controls that can contain rich content, such as <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Image> controls.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> can contain one or more <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> objects as its descendants.
A TreeView is defined as a hierarchy of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem> objects.
A TreeView can populate its tree by binding to a data source and using <xref:System.Windows.HierarchicalDataTemplate> objects.
Examples of data sources include <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> and <xref:System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection%601> objects.
Displaying a large number of items may cause performance issues.
See [Optimizing Performance: Controls](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for more information.
To improve the performance of a TreeView, see [How to: Improve the Performance of a TreeView](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For more information about the TreeView control, see the [TreeView Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
A TreeView has a limited number of levels.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual>.
Customizing the TreeView Control To apply the same property settings to multiple TreeView controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
To see the parts and states that are specific to the TreeView, see [TreeView Styles and Templates](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
> [!NOTE] > Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in TreeView control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](../Topic/Customizing%20the%20Appearance%20of%20an%20Existing%20Control%20by%20Creating%20a%20ControlTemplate.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref> class.
Expands the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> control and all its child <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> elements.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> to expand.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> and all its child elements were expanded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> to use to display content.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem"></xref> to use as a container for content.
Gets whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref> can scroll.
Always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> because the control has a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ScrollViewer"></xref> in its style.
Determines whether the specified item is its own container or can be its own container.
The object to evaluate.
if item is a ; otherwise, .
Defines an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref> control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.TreeViewAutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref> control.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.GotFocus"></xref> routed event.
The data for the event.

Provides class handling for an <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithinChanged"></xref> event when the keyboard focus changes for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref>.
The event data.

Provides class handling for an <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemContainerGenerator.ItemsChanged"></xref> event that occurs when there is a change in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items*> collection.
The event data.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> event for a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref>.

This implementation sets <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.Handled%2A> to `true` if one of the following keys is pressed together with the CTRL key: - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key> - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key> - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key> - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key> - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key> - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key> - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key> - <xref:System.Windows.Input.Key>
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItemChanged"></xref> event when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem*> property value changes.

The event data that the parameter `e` provides contains an <xref:System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.OldValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and a <xref:System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs.NewValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

The <xref:System.Windows.DependencyPropertyChangedEventArgs.OldValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is set to the item that was previously selected, or is set to `null` if there is no previously selected item.
Similarly, the <xref:System.Windows.Ink.PropertyDataChangedEventArgs.NewValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is set to the newly selected item, or is set to `null` if no new item is selected.
Provides the item that was previously selected and the item that is currently selected for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItemChanged"></xref> event.
Gets the selected item in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref>.

The SelectedItem property on the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> control is a read-only property and is set to an item when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem.IsSelected%2A> property value of the item <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> is set to `true`.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
The selected object in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref>, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if no item is selected.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem*> changes.
## Routed Event Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier Field|| |Routing Strategy|Bubbling| |Delegate|| ## XAML Attribute Usage ``` ```
To be added.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItemChanged"></xref> routed event.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem*> dependency property.
To be added.
Gets the value of the property that is the specified by <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValuePath*> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem*>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValuePath%2A> property specifies the path to the property that is used to determine the value of the SelectedValue property.
For example, assume that a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> is bound to a collection of objects of type `Employee`, which has two properties called `EmployeeName` and `EnployeeNumber`.

You can use a <xref:System.Windows.HierarchicalDataTemplate> to display the value of `EmployeeName` in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> and set <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValuePath%2A> to `"EmployeeNumber"` to have SelectedValue return the value of `EmployeeNumber`.
The SelectedValue property is a read-only property.

To change the value of a selected item in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem%2A> property to access the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeViewItem>.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|

The value of the property that is specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValuePath*> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem*>, or <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if no item is selected.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.

Gets or sets the path that is used to get the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValue*> of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItem*> in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.TreeView"></xref>.
The SelectedValuePath property specifies the path to the property that is used to determine the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValue%2A> property.
For example, assume that a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> is bound to a collection of objects of type `Employee`, which has two properties called `EmployeeName` and `EnployeeNumber`.

You can use a <xref:System.Windows.HierarchicalDataTemplate> to display the value of `EmployeeName` in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView> and set SelectedValuePath to `"EmployeeNumber"` to have <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValue%2A> return the value of `EmployeeNumber`.
## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
A string that contains the path that is used to get the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValue*>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_String.Empty" name="String.Empty" href=""></xref>.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValuePath*> dependency property.
To be added.
Identifies the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedValue*> dependency property.
To be added.
